customize.text: Trailers and Story Teasers
Story Teaser - Yakshas: The Guardian Adepti

<color=#ffd780>January 27, 2021</color>
Alatus is the Golden-Winged King who is also the Conqueror of Demons. None knows whence he came, nor whither he went.
Only at springtime, during the offering of lanterns at night, might the people see the glow at Guyun and declare: "Behold, the Vigilant Yaksha ends the dominion of daemons!"
Or they might hear the sound of a flute amongst the marsh reeds, but find none who play the flute, and thus declare: "Hark, the yaksha calls to summon his old friends to their homeland."
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Story Teaser: Only Old Memories Remain

<color=#ffd780>June 2, 2022</color>
After the end of a crisis, the team departed one after another, either in contemplation or fulfillment.
But Xiao invites you to talk, telling you about a Yaksha's awakened memories...
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Story Teaser: Echoes of the Heart

<color=#ffd780>January 21, 2023</color>
Fleeting like transient clouds, adrift like floating weeds.
The gentle stream trickles by, cleansing fallen dust.

Related Books and Items
Yakshas

Yakshas are Adepti, illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected the land since ancient times, along with Rex Lapis and other Adepti. During the Archon War, they fought alongside Morax and were present when Guizhong returned to the elements. It was Yakshas who held back the barrier placed over her to prevent the spread of dark energy. Among all Yakshas, there were five strongest: Bosacius, Alatus, Menogias, Indarias and Bonanus. They became known throughout the world simply as "The Yakshas."

After the Archon War, the lands of Liyue were plagued by pestilence and famine. The rotting remains of the defeated gods spread across the world, reborn into demons. The monsters' rage manifested in the form of diseases, monster infestations, and other strange occurrences. Then, Rex Lapis summoned the Yakshas to vanquish the demons. They swore an oath: <color=#ffffffd9>"Restore order through slaughter, purge evil through battle. To this, we dedicate our lives."</color> Being the most fierce and warlike of all the Adepti, they were ready to do anything to protect the lands.

For many years, Yakshas faithfully protected Rex Lapis and pacified all manner of catastrophes in the world. But there came a day when they, despite their might, found that their deeds had taken their toll and that the remnants of divine bitterness had begun to poison them. Having fallen under the influence of the hatred of the defeated gods, they became bound by the karmic debt. Karmic debt is a kind of poison for Yakshas, their punishment for countless murders; it causes them severe pain, infects their consciousness, and causes anger, pain, and horror. Some descended into a blind rage of a kind that cannot be put into words or were driven by fear to equally indescribable madness. Some turned on and destroyed each other. Some were lost to delusions of the mind.

customize.text: Bosacius

Bosacius was the first Yaksha summoned by Rex Lapis, from whom he received the title Marshal Vritras. Living in Tianqiu, he was the elder brother to The Yakshas and had a strong spirit. He took the form of a man with four arms, used the power of Electro, and knew how not only to fight himself but also to lead others into battle. For this, he was highly respected. Bosacius's favorite technique was to lure the enemy and attack him at an unexpected moment. Because of the karmic debt, Bosacius lost his mind and disappeared, leaving all his wealth sealed by the Adeptal arts.

500 years ago, the Cataclysm occurred. The monsters of the Abyss infested the seven kingdoms of Teyvat, and Liyue was no exception. To give the injured civilians a safe escape and to maintain their honor in the eyes of Rex Lapis, the Milleliths bravely fought the monsters in the Chasm, when suddenly, the four-armed Yaksha appeared on the battlefield. Having gone mad, at the decisive moment, he distracted the monsters towards himself. Together with him, the Milleliths moved deeper into the Chasm. In the course of fighting side-by-side with the Yaksha, these mortal soldiers could not escape being contaminated by karma or harmed during the slaughtering. To avoid being consumed by the darkness of constant killing, the Millelith soldiers used the timepiece to silently mark the passage of time during each battle. They fixed a unified marching pace and schedule so that one squadron of mortal soldiers would take the battlefield as the one before they retreated. This cycle of advance and retreat continued all the way to the depths of the Chasm, where yaksha and valiant soldiers both fell.

Bosacius, together with Boyang, Yelan's grandfather, descended into the sub-space of the Chasm, where time and space were distorted. Because of the karmic debt, Bosacius forgot his brothers and sisters, why he came to the Chasm, and even his name. In his delirium, Bosacius called Boyang either Menogias or Alatus, but the latter only patiently corrected him.

At the cost of their lives, Boyang and Bosacius were able to seal the sub-space using the Fantastic Compass, an artifact capable of altering space and sealing monsters. Before dying, the four-armed Yaksha's mind cleared and he remembered his brothers and sisters. Bosacius remained trapped in the Chasm, and Alatus later encountered his phantom manifestation in the sub-space when he arrived in the mines to search for his missing brother.
